notes.title: Funding
notes.p: The results of the present study are part of a research project entitled “Biotechnological treatment and valorization of blends of olive mill waste-waters and crude industrial glycerol to produce compounds of added-value using strains of the yeast Yarrowia lipolytica”. This research has been co-financed—via programme of State Scholarships Foundation (IKY)—by the European Union (European Social Fund-ESF) and Greek national funds through the action entitled “Strengthening Human Resources Research Potential via Doctorate Research”, in the framework of the Operational Programme “Human Resources Development Program, Education and Lifelong Learning” of the National Strategic Reference Framework (NSRF) 2014–2020.
